item.title: cecille add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books. A sweet mission in this world dominated by disorder and decay." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: cecille add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description:
"Then why do you want to know?"
"Because learning does not consist only of knowing what we must or we can do, but also of knowing what we could do and perhaps should not do." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: cecille add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "recognize the evidence through which the world speaks to us like a great book..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: cecille add a quote by Connie Willis
item.description: "There are a hundred ways a man can bleed to death. And he can be pulled from the rubble of bitterness, of despair, as well as the wreckage of the Phoenix. And which rescue is the more real? Nothing you could have done for me... was more important than the restoration of my hope." -- Connie Willis

item.title: cecille add a quote by Connie Willis
item.description: "Will I ever see you again? No. Do I love you? Yes, for all time." -- Connie Willis

item.title: cecille add a quote by Justin Cronin
item.description: "The things of your life arrived in their own time, like a train you had to catch. Sometimes this was easy, all you had to do was step onto it, the train was plush and comfortable and full of people smiling at you in a hush, and a conductor who punched your ticket and tousled your head with his big hand, saying, Ain’t you pretty, ain’t you the prettiest girl now, lucky lady taking a big train trip with your daddy, while you sank into the dreamy softness of your seat and sipped ginger ale from a can and watched the world float in magical silence past your window, the tall buildings of the city in the crisp autumn light and then the backs of the houses with laundry flapping and a crossing with gates where a boy was waving from his bicycle, and then the woods and fields and a single cow eating grass....... .....Because sometimes it was one way, easy, and sometimes it was the other, not easy; the things of your life roared down to you and it was all you could do to grab hold and hang on. Your old life ended, and the train took you away to another..." -- Justin Cronin

item.title: cecille add a quote by Justin Cronin
item.description: "That was always the hardest part, missing you." -- Justin Cronin

item.title: cecille add a quote by Julia Quinn
item.description: "Something important is always about to happen... And if not, you'd do well to act as if it were. You'll enjoy life better that way." -- Julia Quinn

item.title: cecille add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "I will remember this, thought Ender, when I am defeated. To keep dignity, and give honor where it's due, so that defeat is not disgrace. And I hope I don't have to do it often." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: cecille add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "The story is one that you and I will construct together in your memory. If the story means anything to you at all, then when you remember it afterward, think of it, not as something I created, but rather as something that we made together. " -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: cecille add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Peace. That's what salaam means. Peace unto you." The words brought forth an echo from Ender's memory. His mother's voice reading to him softly, when he was very young. ... The kiss, the word, the peace were with him still. I am only what I remember, and Alai is my friend in a memory so intense that they can't tear him out. Like Valentine, the strongest memory of all." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: cecille add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "...it's so easy, when you never meet people, when you never know the Earth itself... it's easy to forget why Earth is worth saving. Why the world of people might be worth the price you pay." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: cecille add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Any decent person who knows what warfare is can never go into battle with a whole heart." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: cecille add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "People above you, they never want to share power with you. Why you look to them? They give you nothing. People below you, you give them hope, you give them respect, they give you power, cause they don't think they have any, so they don't mind giving it up." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: cecille add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "So the day became one of waiting, which was, he knew, a sin: moments were to be experienced; waiting was a sin against both the time that was still to come and the moments one was currently disregarding. " -- Neil Gaiman
